Text.Value: This is clear. Their deaths linger in your mind. A puzzling slaughter - wasteful and primitive. I could have used them.
I sought nourishment, but found their bodies cold, their minds dark. A pity to see such a meal wasted.
I have supped well. Thoughts, emotions, memories. The experiences of the mature, the dreams of the young... exquisite, all of it. I look forward to more.
I met these people before... you slaughtered them.
Look well. Our stupidity. Our price to pay.

EditorData.NodeContext: Restrained anger - we let a mind flayer go, and just found it again after it killed a family. This was against her better judgement, and she wants to kill the flayer.

Text.Value: Monster. I should have stopped you while I had the chance before.
*You recognise the newborn mind flayer from the windmill before. It seems it has been busy.*
*You recognise the newborn mind flayer from the windmill. It seems your own cold-bloodedness robbed it of a potential meal here.*
What a darling child we have raised. We helped it to live, and it helped itself to this family's brains.
Meals. Energy - repurposed for a higher calling. Do not dwell on the fate of cattle.
My handiwork. You will have to seek your next meal elsewhere.
This is our fault. These people died because of us. What were we thinking?
When a ghaik goes free, it will always exact a price. So it always was, so it always will be.
Leave.
Attack.
Perhaps it was a mistake, letting you go free.
Who were these people?
I shall need to find nourishment elsewhere. There is nothing left here but broken vessels.
Justice does not entail granting mercy to monsters. We should not have let this abomination go free.
We showed mercy to a mind flayer, and now a whole family's paid the price.
A cruel conclusion to the mercy we showed, but hardly an unpredictable one. As long as it lives, so will its appetite.
A whole family slain? Careful - your appetite will bring a mob down on your head.
Such diverse flavours to be found in a mind - poetry, perversion and all in-between. This city will have much to offer.
Aww, look who's all grown up.
Perhaps it was a mistake to kill this household. At least I would have sated my hunger.
What are we seeing, Boo? This cannot be our doing - can it?

EditorData.NodeContext: Aghast at the sight of a family killed by a mind flayer - that we released earlier in the game.

Text.Value: But you did not - you aided me. Only a fool would have sought to impede progress - evolution.
I fed. Energy changed from one form to another. The essence of all things. Do not mourn my bodily functions.
So be it. Let the feast come to me.
We allowed this unnatural thing to live - now a whole family's worth of blood is on our hands.

Synopsis:
Windmill mindflayer dialog if it was fed in Wyrmscrossing and not defeated - it reappears in a house in BG where it killed the family that lived in the house.

Edge-cases alert: players may have already killed the family before the mindflayer reappears, what should be reflected in his dialog.
